Case reference: 2019020557.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, at 9:00 pm, Rebecca Dorman was last seen leaving a friend's residence located at the intersection of Mohawk Road East and Upper Wellington Street in Hamilton, Ontario. Rebecca had been staying with her friend, and left the residence without her shoes, purse, phone or keys.

Case reference: 2013000049.CaseDesc: On May 9, 2008, Jean-Francois Rousseau was seen for the last time near the Mont-Tremblant park in Quebec.

Shirt: Blue, White, Plaided dark and doubled
Scar: Forehead, vertical in the middle of the forehead

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Marlene was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Marlene was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 2014004438.CaseDesc: Catherine Smith was last seen leaving a party in Spryfield, Nova Scotia in 1964.

Case reference: 2014001952.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, James Neckoway and a friend left Bird, Manitoba by canoe to go hunting and fishing. They intended to travel down the Limestone River, and then down the Nelson River. The canoe in which the men were travelling and the body of Mr. Neckoway's friend were recovered on September 23. Mr. Neckoway has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2010000198.CaseDesc: Tim Mason was known to be an avid walker, frequenting trails and off-road areas. He left his house on foot during the morning and never returned. Mr. Mason suffered from heart problems.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Salt and Pepper

Case reference: 2014005974.CaseDesc: Éric Descoteaux's relatives have had no news of him since January, 2009. Mr. Descoteaux lived in the town of Harrington in the Laurentians.  He left there without warning, and stopped contacting his relatives.

Case reference: 2014003161.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1985, Andrew Pasztor was reported missing in Richmond, British Columbia.  Andrew had left home with the family vehicle which was later found at a restaurant in North Vancouver.  Andrew has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Beige, Vinyl with imitation fur collar

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014005809.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2012, Martha Kelly was last seen walking near her residence in Perth Andover, New-Brunswick. Martha suffered a brain injury in the past, leaving her at times with short term memory problems. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021044031.CaseDesc: David-Alexandre Beliveau was reported missing on September 27, 2021 and was last known to be in Calgary, Alberta on September 4, 2021. David has a number of unique tattoos on his hands, arm and back.

Hair: Brown, Wears a full brown beard
Tattoo: Torso (Front), Map of the Province of Quebec
Torso (Back), 3 Monkeys (See no evil, hear no evil and speak no evil)
Right Hand, Smiley face symbol on back of hand
Left Hand, Dice on back of hand

Case reference: 2006026899.CaseDesc: Dr. Kemp left his residence in Sturgeon Falls, on May 19, 1960, to go fishing. On May 20, 1960, he failed to return home and was reported missing. On May 21, 1960, his vehicle was found parked at Finlayson Lake, McLaren Township, District of Nipissing. His canoe and personal belongings were located on the lake.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017075870.CaseDesc: Andrew Jutte was last seen around September 20, 2017, in the downtown core of Vancouver, British-Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003070.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1996, Yolande Trudeau Laberge was seen for the last time near the Larocque Bridge in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Quebec. Yolande has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Arm, Under arm, approximately 1 inch

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents
Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Straight, Dyed, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2012020075.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1974, Annie Yassie was seen for the last time by a taxi driver in Churchill, Manitoba. At that time, Annie was accompanied by a male friend.

Case reference: 2014006285.CaseDesc: Philippe Guerin was reported missing from the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital on June 12, 1966. He is paralyzed on the left side as a result of having Polio at 10 years of age. He is missing his upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014001798.CaseDesc: On March 3, 1987, Nancy Dumas was reported missing. She was last seen by her daughter. Nancy had said that she was going to find her friends, and left her daughter's residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023019635.CaseDesc: Sridhar Nidammanuri's roommate last saw him on April 21, 2023, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Québec. Sridhar left behind his Indian passport, wallet, banking cards and identification.  Sridhar speaks English and is known to travel on foot.  Authorities have reasons to be concerned about his well-being.

Sweater: Red, White, Red sweater with white stripes
Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right cheek
Left Eye, Mole near the left eye

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2010003699.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday, May 31, 1974, 7 year old Cheryl Hanson left her home on Bloomington Road for a 10 minute walk to her cousin’s house, also located on Bloomington Road. She never arrived.  No trace of Cheryl or any of her belongings has ever been found.

Other: Paper bag with white pajamas with floral design

Case reference: 2006018399.CaseDesc: David Sawyer and his girlfriend were last seen on May 17, 1977. They went fishing for the day on Pickerel Lake. Their capsized canoe was recovered but Mr. Sawyer has not been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2013000045.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1963, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Noreen Greenly was seen for the last time leaving her friend’s house. Noreen had told her friend that she was going to wait for the bus at the bus stop across the street. The bus driver was interviewed and he stated that he did not pick her up. A witness had reported seeing a young girl get into a small blue car, and sit close to the driver at approximately the same time and location. The car was described as a 1957 to 1959 Ford Perfect which was in good condition.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, A thin necklace with blue pendant
Purse: Dark Blue, dome fastener, change purse with $0.70 inside
Scar: Right Knee, Center of knee cap

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2014005776.CaseDesc: James Turgeon was last seen on Wednesday, April 17, 2012 at approximately 3:00 p.m. traveling East on foot on Highway #16 near North Battleford, Saskatchewan. James has known mental health issues and has been diagnosed with schizophrenia. He has a history of walking away from his residence, but will usually return. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001761.CaseDesc: Henrietta Mille is originally from Nain, Newfoundland and had been living in St. John’s, Newfoundland for quite some time before her disappearance. Henrietta was known to frequent the clubs in the St. John’s downtown area. Her keys, purse and other belongings were found at the Key Club.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2009005099.CaseDesc: Russell Hoffert was a voluntary patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital, Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Hoffert walked away from the hospital grounds, in poor winter like weather and was not properly dressed for the conditions. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2016047824.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2016, Marie-Claude Hebert was last seen leaving her residence, on foot, on St-Calixte Street in Plessisville, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Sweater: Cotton, Black, Unknown logo on the front

Case reference: 2021059094.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2021, Leslie Peesker was last seen riding his gold Kona 10-speed bicycle with saddle bags and tent at the intersection of Highway 11 and Highway 312, in Rosthern, Saskatchewan. His family reported that he was on his way to Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. Leslie has been known to camp outdoors for extended periods of time, but having no communication with his family is out of character for him.

Case reference: 2014005024.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2007, Pierre Landry was seen for the last time in the area of Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec. Pierre would have left his residence on foot and there are no indications in the direction he would have taken.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2007004499.CaseDesc: Rod Pavan was last heard from on August 10, 2007. Mr. Pavan advised his landlord that he was moving to British Columbia that day. His vehicle was later found near Shannon Lake Road, north of Val Cote, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005578.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1980, Alexander Calder was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Calder was transient in nature, and frequented social service agencies in the downtown area of Edmonton. He was also known to frequent Edmonton’s river valley, and is described as having a cognitive impairment.

Case reference: 2018029665.CaseDesc:
On May 29, 2018, at approximately 12:40 p.m., Vernon Otto last spoke with his wife
over the telephone, as he was on their property in St. Clements, Manitoba. During the
course of their conversation, Vernon had told his wife that he was going to speak with
a neighbour about vehicle ramps he had lent to him. Vernon had also told her that he
was going to go the Interlake area to look at farm machinery, specifically a crawler.
Vernon's truck was found burnt on May 30th, 2018, at 5:20 pm, a few miles from his
residence.

Case reference: 2020024716.CaseDesc: In August 1975, David Bleaney was seen for the last time in Charleston, West Virginia, in the United States. David was born in Ontario, Canada, and had moved to the United States. During the time of his disappearance, David had failed to attend a court appearance.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2014002578.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1979, Martin Corbet was seen for the last time as he went hunting in the woods.

Hat: Wool, Yellow, Toque; Yellow, Black, Orange

Case reference: 2014002401.CaseDesc: Jane was a student at Laurentian University in Sudbury, Ontario. She was last seen on August 9, 1975, in her apartment just before she went to bed at 2:00 a.m. The next day she was not seen or heard from, and was reported missing. Her personal belongings were left behind. It appears that Jane may have been a victim of foul play.

Scar: Forehead, Small round scare between the eyebrows.

Case reference: 2014005078.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1992, Gloria Abotossaway was last seen by a family member on Shuter Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2014005870.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, André Bellemare was last seen by his wife at his residence in Trois-Rivières, QC. On May 24, 2012, Mr. Bellemare’s vehicle was found abandoned in the woods near the ZEC Tawachiche territory, located in the municipality of Lac-aux-Sables. Despite the discovery of the vehicle, so far the searches have been unsuccessful in locating Mr. Bellemare.

Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Plaid, size XL
Shoes: Brown, Size 10, Treking North Face brand

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014005913.CaseDesc: On October 27, 2012, Douglas Bender was seen for the last time in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba. He is known to frequent the downtown area. It is uncharacteristic for him not to be in contact with his family. At the time of his disappearance, Douglas was despondent.

Jacket: Grey, Brown, Winter/parka with fur-trimmed hood

Case reference: 2012020096.CaseDesc: On September 17, 2008, Kevin Michel was with two other people at Usinne Lake, near Creighton, Saskatchewan, harvesting rice. Witnesses state Kevin walked away from their camp for reasons unknown. Extensive ground, air and water searches were conducted in the area but failed to locate Kevin.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Kevin heart bombers" (text) or "Kevin (heart symbol) bombers"

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2021036748.CaseDesc: Paul Doughty was last seen on August 18, 2021 at a business near McKay Loop Road and Route 175, near Pennfield, New Brunswick.  On September 1, 2021 Paul's vehicle was located in a wooded area 10 kilometers north-east from Mckay's blueberry stand in Pennfield, New Brunswick. Investigators believe there is no foul play suspected.

Case reference: 2014004681.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1965, Archie Laroque was hunting with six other people near Laroque Lake, 48 kilometers east of Carrot River, SK. The hunting party split up and Archie was last seen walking in an area alone. Extensive ground and air searches were conducted, however, Archie was never located.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top
Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2023031245.CaseDesc:
On June 14, 2023, Cody Higbee was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.  Cody is known to spend time in the areas near Chinook Centre and in the Bridlewood area near the ctrain lines.

Cody has a medical condition and may be confused or disoriented.

Tattoo: Left Arm, "WHAT YOU GIVE IS WHAT YOU GET"

Case reference: 2023048947.CaseDesc: Autumn Dillon was last seen in September of 2023 in Lloydminster, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014005182.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2007, at approximately 9:00 am, Richard Anthony Greyeyes was last seen at his residence in Calgary, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, On knuckles caused by curling iron

Case reference: 2012020037.CaseDesc: The last known whereabouts of John Old Shoes is that he was camping in the Blood Reserve Timber limits area. This area is located between the Waterton Lakes National Park and the Chief Mountain Border Crossing in southern Alberta. He was last seen on 1 April 2001.

Case reference: 2017056566.CaseDesc: Darryl Gundrum was last seen between March 1 and September 30, 1970, near Sherwood Park, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020045.CaseDesc: The RCMP is seeking assistance in locating Shirley Ann WAQUAN. She was last seen on July 1, 2007 in Fort McMurray.

Case reference: 2023061459.CaseDesc: Darwin Johnsgaard was seen for the last time on October 18, 2023, at the Dollarama in Strathmore, Alberta.  Darwin frequents the Mustard Seed Shelter in Calgary, Alberta.

Hat: Black, BALL CAP, Gas Monkey Garage
Scar: Right Side Of Head, Scar right side of head

Case reference: 2014004934.CaseDesc: On February 28, 1976, at approximately 5:30 pm, Jean Cardinale was seen for the last at the Bayview Village Plaza in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009004899.CaseDesc: Sacha Latulippe left Montreal Airport for Mexico city on October 15, 2009. He advised his family he was leaving for business. Investigation revealed he had 2 wives in different towns and was leading a “double life”. He left with his business partner Eric Marcel on this same flight. Mr. Marcel is also missing.

Hair: Blonde, Brush Cut, Spikey/gelled, natural brown; Sideburns

Case reference: 2017045193.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2017, Walter Allan left his residence to attend a coin collecting conference in Montreal, Quebec.  Walter did not attend the conference and on July 21, 2017, was last seen on security footage near Iberville, Quebec. Walter's vehicle was later located on August 24, 2017, in a field near Saint-Barthelemy, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005193.CaseDesc: Margaret Schwabe was last seen at her home in East St. Paul, Manitoba. She has not been seen since.

Hair: Grey, Wavy, Short, Hair was dyed dark brown with a red undertone
Teeth: Full upper dentures and a partial dental plate on lower jaw

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2022009281.CaseDesc: Heather Stoodley and her father moved out of their Burlington, Ontario home in October 2021 to live off-grid due to religious obligations. In the course of this process, they ceased utilizing social media and all other known technologies and cancelled their bank accounts. Her mother, who was worried that her daughter wouldn't be able to leave if she had a change of heart, reported her missing in March 2022. Heather’s whereabouts or ability to be reached has not been established.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014003747.CaseDesc: Karoly John "Charles" Horvath, a visitor from England, arrived in Kelowna BC in early May 1989.  He worked throughout the community at part time jobs and stayed in a local hostel and at a local campground.  He was last seen on Friday, May 26, 1989.  All his belongings were left behind at the campground where he had been staying.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, side profile of a skull with mohawk style haircut

Case reference: 2013000062.CaseDesc: Leonard Pinnock has been missing since March 27, 2011. He is originally from Jamaica. He came to visit his family in Montreal and he never made it to the meeting place. He was last seen in the area of Notre-Dame-de Grâce in Montreal, Quebec. He travels between Toronto, Ontario, Montreal and Jamaica.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Albert Morris Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow in Manitoba. When he failed to return three days later, he was reported missing. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, his boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Albert has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that he drowned.

Case reference: 2018053572.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1996, Maymuna Mohamid was seen for the last time by her brother and sister-in-law in Toronto, Ontario. When her brother returned home, Maymuna and all her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2014003872.CaseDesc: Diane Bélanger was last seen on August 8, 1982, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014002416.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1983, Desmond Runstedler was believed to be travelling to Ontario and was last seen standing on the side of Highway #13 near Lougheed, AB.  His personal items were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2014004183.CaseDesc: Virginia Sampare was last seen on October 14, 1971. Ms. Sampare was despondent over the death of her boyfriend. Ms. Sampare left the residence in the evening of that date and was not seen again.

Shirt: Cotton, Short sleeve navy blue shirt

Case reference: 2014003143.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1978, Diane Jaspersen, native of Calgary, Alberta, was last seen in Hope, British-Columbia. She was hitch hiking with her dog "Jack" on the highway leading towards Vancouver Island. Diane was headed to a friend's  cabin  where she was supposed to be staying and attend a festival, but never made it.

Case reference: 2014004643.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2002, Carol Tuks was last seen while exiting a Greyhound bus in Red Deer, Alberta.

Pierce: Ears, single piercing in each ear

Case reference: 2024000604.CaseDesc: Karan Patel was last seen near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario, on January 3rd, 2024, at approximately 12:30 pm. At the time of his disappearance Karan was feeling despondent.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Green, Ring
Shoes: Black, White, NIKE brand running shoes

Case reference: 2014002183.CaseDesc: On July 1st, 1979, John Wong was seen for the last time leaving the area of the Grace Gospel Church in Niagara Falls, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Portage Road in close proximity to the Niagara River. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021038965.CaseDesc: On May 8, 2012, at approximately 11:25 a.m., Linda Manz was last seen near the area of Prospect Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, Linda was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. He did not arrive at the site, and it was assumed that he had returned to camp. He was reported missing three days later to the RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Andrew has not been located, and his whereabouts are currently unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, Plaid and button up

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2012020653.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2003, Patsy Haysom was last seen when she was dropped off at the back of her residence by a friend.

Shoes: Red, Blue, BUM Equipment Logo, Slip on

Case reference: 2014006329.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2013, David Czerman was taken to Surrey Memorial Hospital for substance impairment.  Later that day, David discharged himself from the hospital and was given a bus ticket at approximately 19:40 hours. He has not been seen by his neighbours or family since November 21, 2013.  David Czerman was depressed and on pain medication for a medical condition.  Family described Mr. Czerman as a recluse, with no friends and only left his residence to go to the local pharmacy as he had trouble walking.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Dragon, Rose, bones skull
Left Forearm, Smurf, eagle, worm, heart
Right Forearm, Wizard, devil, rose, bird

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014005512.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2010, Ivana Ferus was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario, to catch a flight destined for the Czech Republic. Ivana’s apartment keys were subsequently found in a recycling bin.
